abstracts.cdata!:
The Avian Influenza Preparedness Project
            seeks to minimize the threat in Armenia posed to humans, by
            the highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI), and other
            zoonoses in domestic poultry, and, to prepare for the
            control and response to an influenza pandemic, and other
            infectious disease emergencies in humans. The first
            component - animal health - will support activities on
            prevention, control, and eradication of the HPAI; the second
            component - human health - will focus on activities to
            reduce the impact of HPAI, building an effective national
            public health response strategy, within an enabling
            environment, to include the necessary resources, responsive
            to nationwide scale, through proven interventions. The
            public awareness and implementation support component, will
            support and provide information and communication
            activities, to increase awareness, and commitment by the
            government, private sector, and civil society organizations,
            in order to strengthen the understanding among the general
            population about the risk and impact of a potential
            pandemic. Finally, the fourth component - support to
            critical imports - would finance, under Emergency Recovery
            Assistance (ERA) procedures, a positive list of critically
            needed imports, identified as necessary to a response
            program in the event an AI human pandemic would occur.
